description:
What if someone was able to reach into your mind and change your memories? To alter your perceptions, see things that aren't there, and remember events that never happened? You could drive off a cliff believing that you were still on the road, or commit murder without knowing what you had done. Now imagine being one of the people born with this ability. Knowing how easily our entire world can be taken apart, would you accept orders to manipulate others?

That's the conundrum that Hiroki, Satoru and Tsukasa find themselves in as they're employed as psychic hitmen and enforcers by a mysterious agency. Or, at least, that's what might be happening. Because they themselves are almost certainly being manipulated, and the concepts of truth and reality cease to have meaning when you're one of the terrifying beings known as a pet.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Triads
tags.description: Centered around Chinese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

node.description: Ranjou Miyake graduated from Vantan Design Institute Academy. After working for an apparel company, she made her debut as a manga artist in 1998. Her works are always wide-ranging, from gags to serious manga, and are characterized by her unique outlook on the world. Her representative works are Bussen, Pet, and IMURI.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayama11)

Married to [Atsuko Ueno](https://anilist.co/staff/216671/).

Older brother of [Kenji Hayama](https://anilist.co/staff/105419/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kudo_M_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kudo_m_/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVcxdd04vCuhr-1t7mDh3gg)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/). Most known for his work on the [Bleach](https://anilist.co/anime/269/) franchise.

__Birthplace:__ Saitama Prefecture, Japan

Tooru Kitajima, better known as TK, is a singer, songwriter and the lead vocalist and guitarist of the Japanese rock band [Ling Tosite Sigure](http://anilist.co/staff/115154/LingTositeSigure). In 2011, he started to release solo material as "TK from Ling tosite sigure", and started to collaborate with Masayuki Nakano from the former electronic music band [Boom Boom Satellites](https://anilist.co/staff/103901/Boom-Boom-Satellites).

Memai Siren is a band from Fukuoka, Japan formed in 2012.

[Website](https://www.memaisiren.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/memai_fukuoka)

__Members:__
- 京寺 (Kyoudera) - Vo.
- ウル (Uru) - Piano&Vo.
- オオサワ レイ (Rei Oosawa) - Gt.
- 森田康介 (Kousuke Morita) - Ba.
- NARA - Dr.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/studio_pablo)

Founder and representative director of Studio Pablo.
Started as a production assistant at [Satelight](https://anilist.co/studio/41/).
Hara Kazuaki is a CG animator working for Asahi Production.
Yasunori Gotou is an episode director.
